intro: Seaforthia gracilis, commonly known as the slender seaforthia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It has adapted to withstand salt spray and strong coastal winds. Due to its unique ecological niche, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
